raw akas.title: Na Nian Hua Kai Yue Zheng Yuan

akas: Na Nian Hua Kai Yue Zheng Yuan (original title)
Nothing Gold Can Stay World-wide (English title)
akas from release info: Na Nian Hua Kai Yue Zheng Yuan (original title)
Nothing Gold Can Stay World-wide (English title)

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: While treating Shen Xingyi's wounds, Zhou Ying's outspokenness gets her into trouble, but also brings her closer to him. Xingyi is offended by her rejection of an offer to be promoted as his mistress - which would require her to give birth to a baby - and punishes her severely. Zhou Ying retaliates with an escape attempt by sneaking into Wu Pin's carriage.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Zhou Ying is granted shelter at Wu Pin's residence, where she quickly attracts trouble due to her clumsiness. Though most of the servants like to see her gone, she excels in school, where she convinces the teacher to allow her a position as an apprentice. She quickly impresses her classmates with her knowledge on math and business.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: When the Shen family is invited over to the Wu residence to finalize a business deal, Shen Yuesheng is suddenly found murdered. Shen Sihai is convinced that the Wu family is responsible, but fails to deliver prove. Wu Pin thinks that Zhou Ying is not safe in the Wu residence anymore and decides to send her off.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Zhou Ying, having been ordered to leave for deceiving others, bids the Wu residence farewell. Wu Pin shocks the Shen family by attending Yuesheng's funeral, and is attacked after the ceremony. Shen Xiying is hold responsible and is arrested.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Wu Weiwen believes that marriage is the only way to wake Wu Pin up from his coma. Hu Zhicun agrees to marry out his daughter, until Du Mingli informs him on a dark family secret. Because Hu Yongmei does not show up at the altar, Zhou Ying steps in.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Now that Zhou Ying has married Wu Pin, she is expected by the Wu family to behave like a lady, but she has trouble adjusting to her new rank. Shen Sihai does all he can to convince Zhao Baishi to release Shen Xingyi, but has no luck. He is subsequently condemned by the matriarch of the Shen family.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: In his plot against the Wu family, Du Mingli promises to Shen Sihai that he will arrange the release of Shen Xingyi. Xingyi is indeed released, but this is due to a direct order by Zhang Changqing, who works for general Li Hongzhang. Du and Zhang are working together, but Du is not aware that Zhang is secretly trying to frame Wu Weiwen.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Wu Pin grants Zhou Ying to spend an afternoon in town. She encounters an English missionary, with whom she interacts for a while. When the Wu family finds out, they further restrict her freedom. Meanwhile, Hu Yongmei tells Wu Pin that she is in love with him.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: When Wu Pin faints, Zhou Ying uses the medicine given to her by the foreigner to help him recover. Wu Pin uses this situation to allow Zhou Ying to stay at the Wu residence. Zhou Ying and Hu Yongmei along with their servants Chun Xing and Yue Ru later get into a quarrel.

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: A natural disaster has swept the town. Shen Sihai wants to use this disaster to make a fortune on selling food, but Shen Xingyi wants to use food to help the poor. Wu Pin has a similar initiative, and is obstructed by his father, too. Zhou Ying comes up with a solution, but is discovered by Shen Xingyi.

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: Luck takes a fortunate turn when Zhou Ying is both granted to remain at the Wu residence, and is released by Zhao Baishi as Shen Xingyi's property, much to Xingyi's disdain. Meanwhile, Du Mingli's continues to scheme Shen Sihai, and Zhou Ying's father makes a reappearance at the Shen residence.

imdb.title: Nothing Gold Can Stay
plot: Biography of legendary widow Zhou Ying who revitalized the business of Wu's family, a prominent clan in Guanzhong of Shaanxi, in late Qing Dynasty.
